The Dominican Republic (Spanish: República Dominicana) is a country in the Caribbean, located on the eastern half of the island of Hispaniola, the other half belonging to Haiti.
In addition to white sand beaches and mountainous landscapes, the country is home to one of the oldest European cities in the Americas, now part of Santo Domingo.
The first inhabitants of the island were the Taino and the Caribe, an Arawak-speaking people who arrived around 10,000 BC.
The Taino population, within a few years of the arrival of European explorers, had been drastically reduced by the Spanish conquerors.
According to Fray Bartolomé de las Casas in the "Tratado de las Indias", the Spanish conquistadors killed about 100,000 Taino between 1492 and 1498.
This space was once the atrium of a 17th-century convent, of which the only building that survives today is the Church of San Diego, and it is now a museum.
Now it serves as a central square, where many things happen, both day and night.
The garden is surrounded by several restaurants and in the afternoon and evening you can often listen to free concerts from the central pavilion.
Callejon del Beso (Alive of the Kiss): Two balconies separated by just 69 centimeters, which were the scene of an ancient romantic legend.
For a few pennies, some child will tell you the story.
Bowen Island is a popular day trip or weekend excursion, offering the opportunity to kayak, hike, visit shops, restaurants and more.
This typical community is located in Howe Sound, just outside Vancouver, and can be easily reached by scheduled water taxis that depart from Granville Island in the city centre.
For those who love outdoor activities, a hike along the Sea to Sky trail is essential.
Whistler (1.5 hours drive from Vancouver) is an expensive resort but well known for the 2010 Winter Olympics.
During the winter you can enjoy skiing in one of the best ski resorts in North America, while in the summer you can try the real mountain biking.
Permits must be booked in advance. To stay at Sirena you need a permit.

Sirena is the only Ranger station that offers, in addition to camping, temporary accommodation in the dormitory and hot meals.In La Leona, San Pedrillo and Los Patos there are campsites, but no catering.
Parking permits can be purchased directly at the Rangers station in Puerto Jiménez, but credit cards are not accepted.
The parking service (MINAE - Ministry of Environment and Energy) does not issue parking permits more than one month in advance of the expected arrival.
CafeNet El Sol offers a reservation service at the price of $30, or $10 for day passes; details on the operator's Corcovado page.
The Cook Islands are an island nation in the South Pacific Ocean, in free association with New Zealand.
It is an archipelago consisting of 15 islands spread over an ocean surface of about 2.2 million km².
The islands, which share the same time zone as Hawaii, are sometimes considered to be in the same hemisphere as Hawaii.
Although smaller, to some older travelers the island reminds of Hawaii before it became a state, without the large tourist hotels and other transformations.
The Cook Islands consist of 15 different islands, the main ones are Rarotonga and Aitutaki, but there are no cities.
Today in developed countries offering luxury bed & breakfast facilities has become almost a form of art.
The B&Bs of the highest class of course compete especially in terms of bed linen and breakfast.
In fact, in the most refined structures of this category it is easy to find elegant sheets, handmade duvets or vintage beds.
Breakfast can include seasonal delicacies typical of the area or a specialty of the host.
The setting can be a historic building with antique furniture, well-kept gardens and a swimming pool.
Getting in the car and heading for a distant destination has the inherent charm of simplicity.
Compared to larger vehicles, you will certainly already have some familiarity with your car, and you know its limits.
The installation of a tent on a private property or in a city, small or large, can easily be the subject of unwanted attention.
In summary, your car is a great choice for a road trip, but it is hardly a good means of "camping".
Camping by car is possible if you have a van, SUV, sedan or station wagon with fold-down seats.
Some hotels have traditions that date back to the golden age, the era of railways and steamers before World War II, between the 19th and early 20th centuries.
These hotels were located in places where the rich and famous people of the time stayed and often offered fine cuisine and nightlife.
The old-fashioned furnishings, the absence of the latest amenities and a certain timeless grace contribute to their character.
Although they are generally privately owned, they sometimes host visiting heads of state and other authorities.
A traveler with a lot of money might consider the idea of a flight around the world, with stopovers to stay in many of these hotels.
A hospitality exchange network is an organization that allows travelers to get in touch with people who live in the cities they will be visiting.
Usually, to join a network of this type, it is enough to fill out an online form, although some networks offer or require additional verification processes.
A list of available hosts is then provided, in print and/or online, and may sometimes include references and reviews from other travellers.
Couchsurfing was founded in January 2004, after programmer Casey Fenton found a cheap flight to Iceland but could not find accommodation.
He contacted local university students via email and received an exorbitant number of offers of free accommodation.
Hostels are mostly for young people (a typical guest is in his twenties), but you can often find more mature travelers as well.
It is rare to see families with children, but some hostels host them in private rooms.
The city of Beijing, China, will host the 2022 Winter Olympics, thus becoming the first city to host both the Summer and Winter Olympics.
Beijing will host the opening ceremony and closing ceremony, as well as the indoor ice events.
Additional skiing events will take place in the Taizicheng ski resort in Zhangjiakou, which is about 220 km (140 miles) from Beijing.
Most temples hold an annual festival starting from late November to mid-May, which varies according to the annual calendar of the individual temple.

Most of the temple’s celebrations take place as part of the festivals organized for the anniversary of the temple or for the birthday of the deity presiding over the temple or for any other important occasion associated with it.
Kerala temple festivals are very fascinating to see, with the numerous festive barded elephant processions, temple orchestra and other celebrations.
World Fair (normally also referred to as World Exposition or simply Expo) is an international festival of arts and sciences of large size.
Participating countries present artistic and educational exhibitions in their national pavilions to expose world themes or the culture and history of their country of origin.
International horticultural exhibitions are events dedicated to the exhibition of floral arrangements, botanical gardens and everything that has to do with plants.
Although theoretically they can be held every year (as long as they are in different countries), in practice this does not happen.
Generally these events last between three and six months and take place in areas of no less than 50 hectares.
There are many different film formats that have been used over time, the most common one being the standard 35 mm film (36x24 mm negative).
It can usually be refilled quite easily if it runs out, and it provides a resolution more or less comparable to that of an existing DSLR.
Some medium-format analog cameras use 6x6 cm sizes, more precisely a 56x56 mm negative.
This offers almost four times the resolution of a 35 mm negative (3,136 mm2 vs. 864).
Wildlife is one of the most challenging subjects for a photographer, and it requires a combination of factors including luck, patience, experience and the right equipment.
Wildlife photography is often almost taken for granted, but as with photography in any field, a picture is worth a thousand words.
Wildlife photography often requires a long telephoto lens, although other types of lenses are needed for subjects such as a flock of birds or a small creature.
Many exotic animals are difficult to find and commercial photography is regulated by some parks.
Wild animals can be elusive or aggressive, and the environment can be cold, hot or hostile.
There are more than 5,000 different languages in the world, of which more than 20 have at least 50 million speakers.
In addition, written words are often easier to understand than spoken ones, especially addresses, which are often difficult to pronounce clearly.
In many countries, English is spoken very well, but in many others, the knowledge of this language is limited, especially among young people.
Imagine, if you want, a Manchester citizen, a Boston citizen, a Jamaican citizen and a Sydney citizen sitting around a dinner table in a Toronto restaurant.
They entertain each other with stories from their native cities, told in their distinctive accents and in local jargon.
The most convenient way to feed is usually to buy food from the supermarket, but if you don’t have the opportunity to cook, your choices are limited to ready-made foods.
More and more supermarkets offer a department with a greater choice of ready-made foods, and some even offer microwaves or other means of warming food.
In some countries or in some types of store there is at least one in-house restaurant, often rather informal with affordable prices.
Make copies of your policy and insurer contact details and take them with you.
They must show the insurer’s email address and international phone numbers for recommendations/authorizations and to claim compensation.
Keep another copy in your suitcase and online (on your email as an attachment or saved in the cloud).
If you travel with a laptop or tablet, keep a copy in your memory or on your hard drive (accessible without the internet).
Also distribute copies of the policy/contact to fellow travelers and to family or friends at home who are willing to help.
Moose (or wapiti) are not naturally aggressive, but they defend themselves if they perceive a threat.
If people underestimate the potential danger of moose, they may get too close to them and take risks.
Alcoholic drinks have a different effect on everyone, and knowing your own limit is very important.
Possible long-term health events associated with alcohol abuse may include liver damage and even blindness or death.The potential danger increases with the consumption of illegally produced alcohol.
Illegal alcohols may contain various dangerous impurities, including methanol, which, even in small doses, can cause blindness or death.
Eyeglasses can be cheaper abroad, especially in low-income countries where the cost of labor is lower.
Consider getting an eye exam at home, especially if your insurance covers it, and bringing your prescription with you to show when asked.
Luxury brand frames available in these areas can have two types of problems: some may be imitations and the authentic imported ones can be more expensive than those purchased in your own country.
Coffee is one of the most traded commodities in the world and you are likely to find several types of coffee in your home region.
However, in the world there are many characteristic ways of drinking coffee, which is worth trying.
Canyoning (or canyoneering) is the descent to the bottom of a gorge, which can be dry or full of water.

Torrent climbing combines elements of swimming, climbing and jumping, but requires relatively little training and fitness to get started (compared to the training and fitness required for, for example, rock climbing, scuba diving or alpine skiing).
Hiking is an outdoor activity that involves walking in natural environments, often on special hiking trails.
Day trips range from less than a mile to longer distances that can still be covered in a single day.
Day hikes on an easy trail require little preparation and any moderately fit person can enjoy them.
A day out in the open air is also possible for those with babies and preschoolers, although families with young children may require more preparation.
There are around 200 running tour organisations worldwide, most of which operate independently.
Go Running Tours, successor of Global Running Tours, creates networks of dozens of sightrunning providers spread across four continents.
With roots in Running Tours Barcelona and Running Copenhagen, Running Tours Prague and others were quickly added.
When you decide to take a trip, you need to consider various aspects, both before departure and on the way.

When you travel, you have to be aware that things are not as they are at home: the behavior, laws, food, traffic, accommodation, rules, language and so on will be partly different from those of the place where you live.
This is something to always keep in mind to avoid disappointment or even aversion to the habits of the place.

The emergence of travel agencies dates back to the 19th century, and a travel agent is usually a viable alternative for a trip that transcends a traveler’s previous experience in nature, culture, language or low-income countries.
Although most agencies accept mainly regular bookings, many of them specialize in particular types of travel, price ranges or destinations.
Contacting an agent who frequently book similar trips may be the best choice.
Take a look at the trips the agent promotes, both on the website and in the showcase.
If you want to visit the world on a budget, for necessity, lifestyle or challenge, there are different ways to do it.
Basically, they fall into two categories: working while traveling, or trying to limit your expenses, and in this article we’ll deal with the latter.
For those who are willing to sacrifice comfort, time and predictability in order to keep expenses as low as possible, see the article on traveling on a budget.
The advice is based on the assumption that travelers do not steal, violate private property, participate in the illegal market, beg or otherwise exploit other people for their own benefit.
The immigration checkpoint is usually the first stop after disembarkation from an airplane, ship or other means of transportation.
On some cross-border trains, checks are carried out during the journey, so you must always carry a valid identity document when boarding such trains.
On night trains, the driver sometimes collects passports to avoid interrupting the sleep of passengers.
Registration is an additional requirement for the visa process, and in some countries you will need to provide your residence and address to the local authorities.
To do this, you may need to fill out a form at your local police station or go to the immigration office.
In many countries where this type of law is in place, local hotels will handle the registration (ask for extra security).
In other cases, registration is only required for those staying outside the accommodation facilities, but this makes the law less clear, so it is advisable to inquire in advance.
Architecture has to do with the design and construction of buildings, and the architectural elements of a place are often a tourist attraction in their own right.
Many buildings are quite beautiful to see and the view from a tall building or a skillfully placed window can be a treat for the eyes.
Architecture overlaps significantly with other fields of activity such as urban planning, civil engineering, decorative arts, interior design and exterior design.
Considering the considerable distance to many of the pueblos, you will only find a bustling nightlife by traveling to Albuquerque or Santa Fe.
However, almost all of the casinos listed above serve drinks and many of them offer luxury entertainment (especially the larger ones in the Albuquerque and Santa Fe surroundings).
Beware: here the bars of small towns are not always the suitable places for a visitor who comes from another state.
First, in Northern New Mexico, drunk driving is a major problem; there is a high concentration of drunk drivers near the bars in small towns.
We define graffiti murals or unwanted drawings.
Although this phenomenon is far from modern, most people might associate it with young people spraying paint on public and private property.
Nowadays, however, there are also recognized "legal" artists, events and walls in the graffiti world, and in these contexts graffiti looks much more like real works of art than illegible symbols.
Boomerang throwing is a popular skill that many tourists want to learn.
If you want to learn how to throw a boomerang so that it comes back to you, you must first make sure that your boomerang is suitable.
Most boomerangs available in Australia do not actually come back, so for beginners, it is best not to try to throw in windy conditions.
In the traditional hangi meal, food is cooked in a preheated hole in the ground.
The pit can be heated with stones burned on the fire, or in some areas it is the geothermal heat that naturally heats certain parts of the ground.
The hangi method is often used to prepare a traditional barbecue-style dinner.
There are several places in Rotorua where geothermal hangi can be found; other hangi can be tasted in Christchurch, Wellington and elsewhere.
MetroRail offers two fare categories on commuter trains in and around Cape Town: MetroPlus (also called First Class) and Metro (also called Third Class).
The MetroPlus is more comfortable and less crowded but a bit more expensive, although it is still cheaper than a regular metro ticket in Europe.
Each train has both Metro and MetroPlus cars; the latter are always located at the end of the train closest to Cape Town.
Carrying for others - Never leave your bags where they cannot be seen, especially when crossing international borders.
You may find yourself being used as a drug courier without your knowledge, and you may have to deal with a lot of problems.
For example, waiting in line, since the drug dogs could be involved at any time without any notice.
Some countries impose very severe penalties even when the crime is committed for the first time, including imprisonment for more than 10 years or the death penalty.
Unattended bags are vulnerable to theft and can also attract the attention of authorities, who fear possible bombs.
At home, given this constant exposure to local germs, the chances of being immune are very high.
However, in other parts of the world, where the bacterial fauna is new to you, there are much more chances of encountering problems.
In addition, in warmer temperatures, bacteria grow faster and survive longer outside the body.
Here are the scourges of the "Delhi belly", the "Pharaoh's curse", the "Montezuma revenge" and their many friends.
Similar to respiratory disorders in colder climates, intestinal disorders in warmer climates are quite common; they are almost always very annoying, but can not be considered really dangerous.
If you are visiting a developing country or a new part of the world for the first time, you should not underestimate the possibility of a culture shock.
Many capable and balanced travelers have been overwhelmed by the novelty of traveling to parts of the developing world, where so many small cultural adaptations can quickly concentrate.
Especially in the first few days, as a help to settle in, you could treat yourself to the luxury of quality hotels, food and services, in Western style.
Do not sleep on the floor on a mattress or mat in places where you are not familiar with the local fauna.
If you choose to camp, bring a camping bed or hammock to keep away from snakes, scorpions and the like.
In the morning, envelop your home with the aroma of an intense coffee and in the evening with that of a relaxing chamomile tea.
When you are on holiday at home, you have time to treat yourself to something pleasant and to spend a few extra minutes preparing a special tea or coffee break.
If you feel like experimenting, take the opportunity to make some juices or smoothies:
maybe it is the opportunity to discover a simple drink to prepare for breakfast once the daily routine resumes.
If your city has different drinking cultures, visit bars or pubs in neighborhoods you don’t frequent.
For those who are not familiar with medical jargon, the terms "infectious" and "contagious" have different meanings.
An infectious disease is one caused by pathogens, such as viruses, bacteria, fungi, or other parasites.
A contagious disease spreads easily by being in close proximity to an infected person.
Many governments require that incoming visitors and outgoing residents are vaccinated against a number of diseases.
These are requirements that often depend on which countries a traveler has visited or intends to visit.
Among the strengths of Charlotte, North Carolina, is the wide variety of quality options that families can choose from.

Residents from other regions often refer to the particularly family-friendly environment as the main reason for settling there, and visitors often indicate the city as pleasant to live in with children.
Over the past 20 years, the number of child-friendly options in Charlotte’s Uptown area has grown exponentially.
Taxis are not typically used by families in Charlotte, although they can be useful in some circumstances.
If there are more than 2 passengers there is a surcharge: so this option may be more expensive than you should.
Antarctica surrounds the South Pole and is the coldest place on Earth.
Sightseeing is expensive and physically demanding, and is only possible in the summer, from November to February, and is mostly limited to the peninsula, the islands and the Ross Sea.
In summer, mainly in these areas, two thousand collaborators live in about fifty bases, while during the winter months only a small number of people remain.
The Antarctic hinterland is a bare plateau covered by 2-3 km of ice.
Sometimes specialized air tours go inland, for purposes related to mountaineering or to reach the Pole, equipped with a wide base.
The South Pole Traverse is a 1,600 km (1,000 mi) route that connects the McMurdo Station on the Ross Sea to the South Pole.
It consists of compacted snow where the cracks have been filled and marked with flags, and can only be travelled using specialized trains that pull sleds with fuel and supplies.
These vehicles are not very agile, so the path has to undergo a long detour around the Transantarctic mountains to reach the plateau.
The most common causes of injury in winter are related to slippery roads, sidewalks and especially steps.
At least footwear with suitable soles is needed. Summer shoes are usually very slippery on ice and snow. Some winter boots are sometimes slippery as well.
The sole must have a deep enough groove, 5 mm (1/5 inch) or more, and the material must remain soft enough at low temperatures.
In slippery conditions, there are studded boots or crampons to apply on heels or on heels and soles that fit most shoes and boots.
Sand, gravel or salt are often spread on roads and pedestrian streets to improve the grip, and the shoes should be low and wide.
Avalanches are not an anomalous phenomenon; there is a limit to the amount of snow that steep slopes can hold and excess volumes will flow downstream as avalanches.
The fact is that snow is sticky, so to come off it needs some kind of push and often this push is represented by a small amount of snow that comes off.
Sometimes the trigger is the heat of the sun that heats the snow, other times it is the additional snowfall, other times still natural events of another kind, often the cause is man.
A tornado is a vortex of extremely low-pressure air that sucks inward and upward the surrounding air.
They give rise to strong gusts of wind (often up to 100-200 mph) and are able to lift heavy objects into the air and carry them along with the tornado.
They initially look like funnels that descend from the storm clouds and become "tornadoes" as they touch the ground.
Personal VPN providers are a great way to bypass both political censorship and commercial geo-IP filtering.
They are considered better than web proxies for a number of reasons: First, they redirect internal Internet traffic, not just http traffic.
They typically provide more bandwidth and higher quality of service, and because they are encrypted, they are also harder to spy on.
Media companies regularly lie about the purpose of encryption, claiming it is to "prevent piracy."
In fact, region codes do not affect illegal copies in any way; any bit-by-bit copy of a disc will work fine on any device, just like the original.
The real goal is to give these companies more control over their markets: it is all about money flows.
Because the phone calls are made via the Internet, you do not need to use a phone company located where you live or travel.

You don’t even have to ask for a phone number that is in the local district where you live: from the wild Chicken region of Alaska, you can get a satellite Internet connection with a number that appears to be in sunny Arizona.
Often, you have to purchase a global number separately to be reached by PSTN phones, and the location of the number makes a difference to the people calling.
Real-time text translation apps: apps that can automatically translate entire portions of text from one language to another.
Some of the apps in this category can even translate text on signs or other real-world objects into foreign languages when the user points their smartphone at them.

Translation engines have improved considerably and are now often able to provide more or less correct (and more rarely incomprehensible) translations, however it is still possible for them to be completely wrong, so you need to be careful.
One of the main apps in this category is Google Translate which, once the data of the requested language is downloaded, allows offline translation.
The easiest and cheapest way to navigate when you are outside your country can be the use of GPS navigation apps installed on your smartphone.
It can be cheaper than buying new maps for your GPS or a standalone GPS device, or renting one from a car rental.
The operation of the phone may be limited or impossible if a data connection is not available or is out of range.
Every corner store offers a complex variety of prepaid phone cards, which can be used by both telephone booths and regular phones.
While most cards are good for calling any country, some specialize in providing low-cost calls to specific groups of countries.
Access to these services is usually via a toll-free number that can be called free of charge from almost any phone.
The rules of traditional photography also apply to video recording, and not only.
If there is a ban on taking photos, you should not even consider recording a video.
If you use a drone, you should check in advance what you can film and what kind of additional permits or licenses are required.
Flying a drone near an airport or over crowded areas is generally an unfortunate choice, even if it is not considered an illegal practice in your region.
Nowadays it is rare to book flights directly with the airline without first searching and comparing prices.
Sometimes the same flight can appear with widely different prices in different aggregators and before booking it is worth comparing the results and consulting the company’s website.

While you may not need a visa for short visits to certain countries as a tourist or on business, staying as an international student generally requires a longer stay than that of an occasional tourist.
As a rule, staying in any foreign country for an extended period of time requires obtaining a visa in advance.
The requirements and application procedures for student visas are usually different from those for regular tourist or business visas.
For most countries, you will need a letter of offer from the institution you want to study at, as well as proof of sufficient funds to support you for at least the first year of your course.
For more details on prerequisites, please contact the institution and immigration department of the country where you wish to study.
With the exception of diplomats, when you work abroad you usually have to file income tax in the country where you are resident.
Income tax is calculated differently depending on the country, with rates and scales that vary from one country to another.

In some federal countries such as the United States and Canada, income tax is collected at both the federal and local levels, so there may be variations in rates and income categories from region to region.
If immigration control is usually absent or only a formality on returning home, customs controls can prove a nuisance.
Make sure you know what you can and cannot bring with you, and declare anything that goes beyond the limits allowed by law.
The easiest way to get started in the field of travel writing is to hone your skills with an established travel blog website.
Once you are familiar with formatting and editing on the web, then you can create your own website.
Volunteering while traveling is a great way to make a difference, but it’s not just about giving.
Living and volunteering abroad is a great way to experience a different culture, meet new people, get to know yourself better, broaden your perspectives and gain new skills.
It can be a good way to increase your budget and afford a longer stay, as many volunteer jobs offer food and accommodation and some even provide a small salary.
Vikings used Russian waterways to reach the Black Sea and Caspian Sea. Some of these routes are still possible to use, but special permits may be required, and sometimes difficult to obtain.
The White Sea-Baltic Sea Canal connects the Arctic Sea to the Baltic Sea via Lake Onega, Lake Ladoga and St. Petersburg, mostly through rivers and lakes.
Lake Onega is also connected to the Volga, so it is still possible to reach the Caspian Sea through Russia.
Once you reach the marinas, everything will be quite obvious, you will meet other boat hitchhikers who will be happy to share their information.
Basically, you’ll be distributing notices offering your help, walking up and down the docks, approaching people cleaning their yachts, trying to get in touch with sailors at the bar, etc.
Try to talk to as many people as possible, after a while everyone will know you and will give you hints on what boats they are looking for.
It is good to choose the airline within a frequent flyer alliance carefully.

Although you might think that it is advisable to join the airline with which you fly most, it is good to consider that the benefits offered are often different and the points for frequent flyers may be higher with a different airline of the same alliance.

Airlines such as Emirates, Etihad Airways, Qatar Airways and Turkish Airlines have greatly increased their services in Africa and, at competitive prices compared to other European airlines, offer connections to many important African cities.
Since 2014, Turkish Airlines has reached 39 destinations in 30 African countries.
If you have more time for your trip, you can compare your total fare for Africa with the round the world fare.
Don't forget to calculate the extra costs for additional visas, exit taxes, ground transportation and more for all locations outside Africa.
If you want to fly throughout the southern hemisphere, you have a limited choice of flights and destinations due to the lack of transoceanic routes.
No airline alliance covers all three ocean crossings in the southern hemisphere (and SkyTeam does not cover any).
However, Star Alliance flights cover almost everything except the South East Pacific from Santiago de Chile to Tahiti: this area is covered by LATAM Oneworld.
If you prefer to avoid the South Pacific and the west coast of South America (see below), there are other options, in addition to this flight.
In 1994, the Azerbaijani region of Nagorno-Karabakh, with an Armenian majority, declared war on the Azerbaijanis.
With Armenian support, a new republic was established, which is not officially recognized by any established nation, not even Armenia.
Relations between Armenia and Azerbaijan continue to be affected by diplomatic discussions on the region.
The Canal District (Dutch: Grachtengordel) is the famous 17th-century district that surrounds the Binnenstad of Amsterdam.
The entire district is a UNESCO World Heritage Site for its unparalleled cultural and historical value, and its real estate value is among the highest in the country.
Located in the Liguria region of Italy, the Cinque Terre embraces the five small coastal towns of Riomaggiore, Manarola, Corniglia, Vernazza and Monterosso.
They are part of the UNESCO World Heritage List.
Over the centuries, the inhabitants of these places have skillfully built terraces to exploit these rugged and steep lands, building up to the cliffs overlooking the sea.
The lack of concrete corporate development is part of its charm: trails, trains and boats connect the villages, which are not accessible by car.
The French spoken in Belgium and Switzerland differ slightly from the French spoken in France, but are close enough to be mutually understandable.

In particular, in French-speaking Belgium and Switzerland the numbering system has some subtle peculiarities, which differentiate it from that of French spoken in France, also the pronunciation of some words is a little different.
However, Belgians and French-speaking Swiss learn Standard French at school, so they can understand you even if you use the numbering system of Standard French.
In various parts of the world, waving is a cordial gesture that means "hello".

However, in Malaysia, or at least in rural areas, it has the meaning of "come here", just like the index finger bent towards the body, a gesture used in some Western countries, and should be used only for that purpose.
Similarly, a British traveler in Spain may mistake a farewell gesture with the palm pointing towards the person who is greeting (and not the person who is greeted) as a gesture indicating return.

Auxiliary languages are artificial or constructed languages, created with the intention of facilitating communication between peoples who otherwise would have difficulty communicating with each other.
They are distinguished from frank languages, natural or organic languages that, for one reason or another, become the dominant language for communication between people of different languages.
Due to the heat of the day, it can happen to travelers to experience mirages, which give the illusion of seeing water (or other).
They can be dangerous: if the traveler chases the mirage, he will consume precious energy and the remaining water.
Even the hottest desert can become extremely cold at night, and without warm clothing there is a real risk of hypothermia.
Especially in summer, if you plan to hike in the rainforest, you need to beware of mosquitoes.
Even if you’re driving through the subtropical rainforest, it takes just a few seconds with the doors open when you get into the vehicle to let mosquitoes on board.
Bird flu, or more formally avian influenza, can infect both birds and mammals.
Fewer than a thousand cases have been reported in humans, but some of these have been fatal.
The majority of cases have involved poultry farmers, but there is also a certain risk for birdwatchers.
The fjords and steep valleys, typical of Norway, suddenly give way to a more or less even plateau.
These plateaus are often called "vidde", which means a large open space without trees, an endless expanse.
In Rogaland and Agder they are generally called "hei", a term that refers to a treeless heath usually covered with heather.
Glaciers are not stable, but move down the mountain, giving rise to the formation of cracks, hollows, crevices, which sometimes remain hidden by snow bridges.
The walls and ceiling of ice caves are prone to collapse and cracks can re-close.
From the edges of the glaciers huge blocks come off, which then fall and sometimes move away from the glacier by bouncing or rolling.
The peak of the tourist season for hilly destinations normally occurs during Indian summer.
However, they have a different beauty and charm during winter, when several hill stations are covered with a good amount of snow and activities such as skiing and snowboarding are possible.
Only a small number of airlines still offer fares for travel due to a grief, offering small discounts in case of travel related to a sudden grief.
Among the airlines that can offer this service are Air Canada, Delta Air Lines, Lufthansa (for flights departing from the United States or Canada) and WestJet.
In any case, you must make a telephone booking directly with the airline.
